channel.title: Using Google Task with Drafts
channel.description:
![google-tasks|690x313, 50%](upload://k09XebIu6dljQsRrWTNs1Re4u9I.jpeg)
- [**Web Version (in Gmail)**](https://mail.google.com/): On the web, Google Tasks are integrated into Gmail. For help using Tasks on the web, see [Google's documentation](https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=2ahUKEwjJ8YWWhOXwAhWWWc0KHXe2BUgQFjABegQIBBAE&url=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.google.com%2Ftasks%2Fanswer%2F7675772%3Fco%3DGENIE.Platform%253DDesktop%26hl%3Den&usg=AOvVaw07xzw2Ik70f0mdkgonDQUF) - [**App Store**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/google-tasks-get-things-done/id1353634006)
[Google Tasks](https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=2ahUKEwjJ8YWWhOXwAhWWWc0KHXe2BUgQFjABegQIBBAE&url=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.google.com%2Ftasks%2Fanswer%2F7675772%3Fco%3DGENIE.Platform%253DDesktop%26hl%3Den&usg=AOvVaw07xzw2Ik70f0mdkgonDQUF) is Google task management tool, which is available on the web within Gmail, or as an app on iOS and Android.
## Action Steps
Drafts offers native integration with Google Tasks using two available action steps:
#### [Google Task](http://docs.getdrafts.com/docs/actions/steps/services#google-task)
The "Google Task" action step creates a single task in Google Tasks. The default configuration creates a task in your default list, using the first line of the draft as the title, and remaining text (if present) as notes. An alternate list name can be specified in the action configuration, if you would prefer, say, to have an action which sends to your "Grocery" list.
- Example Action: [**Task in Google Tasks**](https://actions.getdrafts.com/a/1mj)
#### [List in Google Tasks](http://docs.getdrafts.com/docs/actions/steps/services#list-in-google-task)
The "List in Google Tasks" action steps creates a task in Google Tasks for each line of the current draft. Very useful for bulk entry of tasks captured in Drafts.
- Example Action: [**List in Google Tasks**](https://actions.getdrafts.com/a/1mk)
This step works similarly to the "List in Reminders" action step, allowing a specific list to be hard-coded in the action, or dynamically specified by prefixing the first line of the draft with a `#`. If the specified list does not exist, it will be created. Notes can also be added by placing additional text on the line after a `|` (pipe) character. For example a using the "List in Google Tasks" action on a draft with the text:
```markdown # Groceries Bananas Apples Grapes|Red Grapes only! ```
Would results in the tasks "Bananas", "Apples", and "Grapes" being added to a list named "Groceries" in To Do. Additionally, the "Grapes" task would have notes "Red Grapes only!" attached.
## URL-Based Actions
It does not appear the Microsoft To Do app supports any special URL scheme commands at this time. Please let us know if you are aware of any we missed.
## Scripting / Direct API Access
For more advanced integrations, Drafts provides the [`GoogleTask` script object](https://scripting.getdrafts.com/classes/googletask).
Using scripting, it is possible to configure more advanced task features, like due dates and reminders, but also import data _from_ Tasks.
The `GoogleTask` object has convenience methods for creating and working with lists and tasks via script, but also can be used to access the entire [Google Tasks API](https://developers.google.com/tasks). Scripting is beyond to scope of this article, but the [documentation](https://scripting.getdrafts.com/classes/googletask) has links to example actions. If you have more advanced integration needs, take a look at the possibilities.
